title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 08 December 2015 - XWiki
content:
<Pbas> has quit  
00:21 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
01:32 <benoitc> has quit  
01:42 <benoitc> has joined #xwiki  
07:49 <cjd> has quit  
08:06 <woshilapin> has quit  
08:10 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
08:14 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:19 <Ramona1> has quit  
08:19 <Ramona2> has joined #xwiki  
08:37 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:49 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:00 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:02 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:16 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:22 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
09:22 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
09:51 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:46 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:54 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
12:20 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
12:45 <gene> has quit  
12:45 <gene> has joined #xwiki  
12:49 <vmassol> I knew that cjd would react :) I have to admit that I laughed alone at my desk when I discovered that the initials of Command Runner API was CRAPI ;)  
12:49 <cjd> :)  
12:50 <cjd> doesn't matter much for that one but jean started laughing so I had to send a mail  
12:50 <vmassol> hehe  
12:50 <vmassol> an easy to remember name!  
12:50 <vmassol> that"s what you asked for!  
12:50 <vmassol> :)  
12:51 <vmassol> ok back to work now, good laugh though  
12:51 <cjd> the XWikiTube one is more like the  xwiki-tools one, in npm it's xwiki-tools but in xwiki land it's node-xwikimodel which makes it hard to keep track of, no universal name  
12:51 <cjd> maybe node-xwiki-tools would have been better, \*shrug\*  
12:51 <vmassol> this is just an internal id and it's limited in characters  
12:52 <vmassol> and you don't use it diredctly  
12:52 <vmassol> so it's ok  
12:52 <cjd> Abother example is syntax-highlighter, in jira it's xwiki-editor-tools and in github it's something different, on extensions it's SyntaxHighlier  
12:53 <cjd> that's what I aim to avoid  
12:53 <vmassol> me too, hence my suggestions for the naming  
12:53 <vmassol> which you refused apparently  
12:53 <cjd> ok  
12:53 <vmassol> I'm fine but don't say that it's not consistent afterwards :)  
12:54 <cjd> Well I want the brand to be XWikiTube, if there is inconsistancy that's better than having a brand which doesn't make sense  
12:54 <cjd> now I decided that   XWikiTube Application  is not harmful to the brand so that's ok for me  
12:54 <ansuz> has joined #xwiki  
12:54 <vmassol> in github it's application-xwikitube, so that name should XWikiTube Application to be consistet  
12:54 <vmassol> ok  
12:54 <vmassol> np  
12:55 <vmassol> honestly I don't want toi fight too much on this  
12:55 <vmassol> I'm just trying to keep some kind of consistency on e.x.o to make it easier for users  
12:55 <cjd> +1  
12:55 <cjd> consistancy when possible, but with enough exceptions that the rigidity of the rule does not make more inconsistancy than it solves  
12:56 <cjd> ^^that's my general thinking, not really a specific comment  
12:56 <vmassol> yes  
13:08 <Enygma`> Am I the only one reading the "XTube" part from "XTubeApp" project name? :)  
13:08 <vmassol> a slick module!  
13:08 <Enygma`> hint: p0rn industry website / popular name  
13:09 <vmassol> XWikiTube, the only true vaseline you need :)  
13:10 <Enygma`> we dodged a bullet with XECS, but it looks like we just can`t help it :)  
13:11 <vmassol> we might have to just accept it and adopt our plan B…  
15:08 <vmassol> someone asking for a light xwiki runtime: http://blog.xebia.fr/2010/04/09/premiers-pas-avec-greenpepper-xwiki/#comments ;)  
15:15 <cjd> has quit  
15:17 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
15:24 <Ramona2> has quit  
16:09 <vmassol> taking risks thomas :)  
16:10 <tmortagne> risks ?  
16:10 <vmassol> upgrading the jdbc driver is always risky in my xp  
16:10 <tmortagne> we don't release anything with MySQL connector in practice, it's just used by xwiki-debug-eclipse right now  
16:10 <vmassol> ok thought we were in the debian package  
16:10 <tmortagne> (when you setup xwiki-debug-eclipse to use mysql)  
16:11 <tmortagne> we use whatever is the standard connector on debian  
16:11 <vmassol> ok  
17:00 <msmeria> has quit  
17:00 <ClemensR> someone on SO asks where the spaces have gone ;)   http://stackoverflow.com/q/34159090/2040545   ... so where is the canonical documentation for that ...  
17:02 <ClemensR> probably http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/ContentOrganization  (?)  
17:04 <vmassol> yes that's the one ClemensR  
17:04 <vmassol> thanks  
17:05 <ClemensR> if someone wants a cheap few reputations you can post an answer - I have no time for it today, really pressed with other stuff :(  
17:09 <vmassol> hehe last time I did this I got banned from SO  
17:09 <vmassol> I was told that I cannot post links  
17:09 <vmassol> and that I need to copy paste the content to SO  
17:09 <vmassol> that made me dislike SO a lot  
17:09 <vmassol> and I couldn't post answers for a year or so afterwards  
17:09 <vmassol> (ClemensR)  
17:10 <ClemensR> ah, yes, they want a "quote of the relevant content" ... duh, did not know they ban people quickly :(  
17:15 <ClemensR> well, I will see if I have time for that question tomorrow evening, hopefully  
17:16 <vmassol> k :)  
17:17 <vmassol> need to fix some blocker bug on my side  
17:20 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:58 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki
